result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Hutchins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber granted for work and any counseling.
First 75 days in, second 75 days on electronic montior if approved by jail and risk assessment.
-Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid. prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Obtain all prescriptions from one pharmacy.
Sign releases of information for the agent.
Engage with other counseling as recommended by the agent.

Pay costs and DNA surcharges. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Defendant Matthew R Hutchins in court with attorney Jay Kronenwetter. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

4:02 PM Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.

There is a plea agreement in this matter.
State files an amended information.

Defendant will plead to all 5 counts.

Atty Kronenwetter concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1: GUILTY
Defendant enters a plea of: Count 2: GUILTY
Defendant enters a plea of: Count 3: GUILTY
Defendant enters a plea of: Count 4: GUILTY
Defendant enters a plea of: Count 5: GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

Address for Defendant is verified.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 2: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 3: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 4: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 5: Contrary to the statute section stated therein

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kronenwetter makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of  150 days, imposed and stayed
Huber granted for work and any counseling 
First 75 days in, second 75 days on electronic montior if approved by jail and risk assessment
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Conditions:
Have an AODA and comply with treatment recommendations
Maintain absolute sobriety
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription
Obtain all prescriptions from one pharmacy
Sign releases of information for the agent
Engage with other counseling as recommended by the agent
Submit DNA sample
Pay court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 2:
Jail sentence of 150 days, imposed and stayed, concurrent to Count 1
Huber granted for work and any counseling 
First 75 days in, second 75 days on electronic montior if approved by jail and risk assessment
Probation for a period of 36 Months concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 3:
Jail sentence of 75 days, imposed and stayed, concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
Huber granted for work and any counseling 
Probation for a period of 36 Months concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 and Count 2
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 4:
Jail sentence of 75 days, imposed and stayed, concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3
Huber granted for work and any counseling 
Probation for a period of 36 Months concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 5:
Jail sentence of 30 Days
Huber granted for work and any counseling
Report to jail today
Sentence to commence within 60 days
May be served on GPS home monitor if approved by jail and risk assessment tool
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

20 days in which to appeal the case

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Matthew Hutchins in court with attorney Jay Kronenwetter. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
Court considers the preliminary hearing waived.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *On court dates.

Defendant Matthew Hutchins in court with attorney Jay Kronenwetter. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

State recommends a signature bond with conditions as stated.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
